segments.text: Great . My family came to visit me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , you must be very happy . How many people are there in your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My immediate family is very large . It's my mother , my father , my two older brothers , my younger sister and me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I have a small family . They are my parents , my younger brother and me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I thought you were the only child in the family . Didn't China practice the only-child policy in the early 1980s ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it did . But my parents are ethnic minority people . It's a preferential policy for an ethnic minority family to have two children .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Interesting . What do you think about families with only one child ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The child must feel very longly . My younger brother is 10 years younger than me . Before he was born , I used to be the only child and always dreamed that I would have a younger sister or brother one day .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you get along well with each other ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , we are very close . He is 12 years old now and very smart . He always makes us laugh a lot .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You are very lucky to have such a nice family .
segments.speaker: S2
